title: Minneapolis Police Shooting: Who Was Daunte Wright and What Happened in Brooklyn Center?
sub_head: A 20-year-old Black man was killed Sunday after police shot him during a traffic stop; police official says officer had intended to use her Taser
body:
Daunte Wright, a 20-year-old Black man, was killed Sunday by a single bullet after police shot him during a traffic stop in the Brooklyn Center suburb of Minneapolis.
Police said the shooting occurred as they were trying to take a driver with an outstanding warrant into custody following a traffic stop just before 2 p.m. Sunday. A police official said that the officer who fired her gun, he believed, had intended to instead use her Taser, which is how officers are trained.
The man who died has been identified as Daunte Wright by state and city officials. A woman who identified herself as Mr. Wright’s mother has said to local media that Mr. Wright has a young son.
“Gwen and I are praying for Daunte Wright’s family as our state mourns another life of a Black man taken by law enforcement,” Gov. Tim Walz wrote in a statement.
Police in Brooklyn Center said the shooting occurred as they were trying to take a driver with an outstanding warrant into custody following a traffic stop Sunday afternoon. An officer shot Mr. Wright after he re-entered his vehicle, police said in a statement. The vehicle traveled several blocks before striking another vehicle. Officers and medical personnel attempted lifesaving measures, but Mr. Wright died at the scene, officials said.
